page.title: 01ROWSLEY AND BEELEY
page.content:
ROWSLEY AND BEELEY
This block lies at the south-western edge of the Peak District National Park.The River Derwent bisects the block from North to South, joining the River Wye at Rowsley.The village of Beeley lies in the centre of the block.The villages are small, although Rowsley was an important railway centre ,and the area is mostly open countryside,consisting of high moorland, forested hills, and the lusher river valley.Tourism is very important,since part of Chatsworth Park, and some of the land belonging to Haddon Hall is in this block.This, together with the Derbyshire custom of well-dressing, and the unspoilt, hilly scenery, brings many summer visitors to patronise the hotels and inns.
